step.title: Transporting batteries without equipment by air

paragraph.htmltext:
Cells transported without equipment

LITHIUM ION CELLS - Fully regulated cells

Applies to: Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 20 Wh/cell

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Label:

  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.
  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

  • Each cell incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each cell is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.

Transport mode: IATA

Packing instructions: P965 Section IA

  • Cells must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging which could cause a short circuit.
  • Cells must be packed so that they are protected against damage caused by the movement or placement of the cells within the packaging.
  • Use only approved packaging conforming to PG II performance level.
  • Lithium ion cells must be placed in inner packagings that completely enclose the cell, then placed in an outer packaging.
  • Complete package must be approved Packing Group II

Packagings:

  • Drums (1A2, 1B2, 1N2, 1H2, 1D, 1G)
  • Boxes (4A, 4B, 4N, 4C1, 4C2, 4D, 4F, 4G, 4H2)
  • Jerricans (3A2, 3B2, 3H2)

Weight limit:

  • Passenger Aircraft: 5 kg Net
  • Cargo: 35 kg Net

Transport cat.: -

Exemptions: -

LITHIUM ION CELLS - Small cells partially exempted

Applies to: Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 20 Wh/cell transported in quantities that exceed the allowance permitted:

  • lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/cell exceeding 2.5 kg net quantity per package;
  • lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 20 per cell, exceeding 8 cells per package.

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Label:

  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.
  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.

IATA ONLY

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Transport mode: IATA

Exemption conditions: PG 965 section IB

Cells must be protected so as to prevent short circuits, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit.

Cells must be packed in inner packagings that completely encloses the cell. The inner packaging must be packed in strong outer packagings.

Packing: Not required approved packaging. Use strong outer packaging, it must be capable of withstanding a 1.2 m drop test in any orientation without damage to cells contained therein, without shifting of the contents so as to allow cell to cell contact and without release of contents.

Weight limit: 10 kg Gross

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, UN 3480

Full Name and Address of the shipper and the consignee

Gross weight

Minimum dimensions: 120 x 110 mm

Where the packages are of dimensions such that they can only bear smaller labels, the label dimensions may be 74 mm x 105 mm.

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Shipper’s Declaration

Each consignment must be accompanied with a document with an indication that:

  • The package contains lithium ion cells;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing lithium ion cells partially excempted; Li-ion Wh rating 15 Wh/cell – N. Cell/package > 8 - Gross weight 8kg

LITHIUM ION CELLS - Small cells exempted

Applies to: Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 20 Wh/cell conforming to the following:

  • Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/cell not exceeding 2.5 kg net quantity per package;
  • Lithium ion cells with a Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 20 per cell, not exceeding 8 cells per package.

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label: Not required

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Transport mode: IMDG

Exemption conditions: PI 965 section II

Cells must be protected so as to prevent short circuits, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit.

Cells must be packed in inner packagings that completely enclose the cell. The inner packaging must be packed in strong outer packagings.

Packaging: Non approved. Each package must be capable of withstanding a 1.2 m drop test in any orientation without damage to cells contained therein, without shifting of the contents so asto allow cell to cell contact and without release of contents.

Quantity limit Cells/package: 8 cells if Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 20 per cell

Weight limit: 2.5 kg Net if Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/cell

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

Minimum dimensions: 120 x 110 mm

Where the packages are of dimensions such that they can only bear smaller labels, the label dimensions may be 74 mm x 105 mm.

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Shipper’s declaration is not required

The words “Lithium ion batteries in compliance with Section II of PI 965” must be included in ‘Nature and Quality of Goods’ bow of the air waybill.

Each consignment must be accompanied with a document with an indication that:

  • The package contains lithium ion cells;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.

Instruction to personnel: Any person preparing or offering cells for transport must reveice adequate instructon on these requirements commensurate with their responsibilities.

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing small exempted lithium ion cells: Li-ion Wh rating 2.6 Wh/cell – Net weight 2.2 kg.

Modules and Packs transported without equipment

LITHIUM ION BATTERIES – Fully regulated batteries

Applies to: Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 100 Wh/cell

IATA Only: Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 100 Wh/battery packed in quantities exceeding:

  • Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/battery exceeding 2.5 kg net quantity per package;
  • Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 100 per battery exceeding 2 batteries per package

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • Each battery incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each battery is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.
  • Each battery containing cells or series of cells connected in parallel must be equipped with an effective means, as necessary, to prevent dangerous reverse current flow (e.g. diodes, fuses).
  • Batteries manufactured after 31 December 2011 must be marked with the Wh rating on the outside case.

Transport mode:

  • Passenger Aircraft
  • Cargo

Packaging instructions: PI 965 section IA

Batteries must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit.

Batteries must be packed so that are protected against damage caused by the movement or placement of the batteries within the packaging.

Use only approved packaging confirming to packaging group II performance level.

  • Lithium metal batteries must be placed in inner packagings taht completely inclose the cell, then placed in an outer packaging.
  • Complete package must be approved Packing Group II

Packaging:

  • Drums (1A2, 1B2, 1N2, 1H2, 1D, 1G)
  • Boxes (4A, 4B, 4N, 4C1, 4C2, 4D, 4F, 4G, 4H2)
  • Jerricans (3A2, 3B2, 3H2)

Batteries ≥ 12 kg (gross) with strong impact resistant outer casing: Not required UN approved packagings for batteries, or assemblies or such batteries, when packed in strong outer packagings or protective enclosures (i.e. fully enclosed or wooden slatted crates).

The packagings need not meet the requirements of Section 6 of IATA Regulation.

The packagings must be approved by the appropriate national authority of the State of origin. A copy of the document of approval must accompany the consignment.

Weight limit:

  • Passenger aircraft: 5kg Net
  • Cargo: 35 kg Net

Transport cat.: -

Exemptions: -

Net weight (kg)

LITHIUM ION BATTERIES – Small batteries partially exempted

Applies to: Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 100 Wh/battery, transported in quantities that exceed following allowance permitted:

  • Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/battery exceeding 2.5 kg net quantity per package
  • Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 100 per battery exceeding 2 batteries per package

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Batteries must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • The Watt-hour rating must be marked on the outside of the battery case except those manufactured before 1 January 2009

Transport mode: IATA

Exempt conditions: PI 965 section IB

Batteries must be protected so as to prevent short circuits, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit.

Batteries must be packed in inner packagings that completely enclose the battery.

The inner packagings must be packed in strong outer packagings.

Packaging: Not required approved packaging. Use strong outer packaging, it must be capable of withstanding a 1.2 m drop test in any orientation without damage to cells contained therein, without shifting of the contents so as to allow cell to cell contact and without release of contents.

Weight limit: 10 kg Gross (both passenger aircraft as cargo)

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

  • LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, UN 3480
  • Full Name and Address of the shipper and the consignee
  • Gross weight

Minimum dimensions of label: 120 x 110 mm

Where the packages are of dimensions such that they can only bear smaller labels, the label dimensions may be 74 mm x 105 mm.

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Shipper’s Declatation

Each consignment must be accompanied with a document with an indication that:

  • The package contains lithium ion batteries;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.

  • Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/battery not exceeding 2.5 kg net quantity per package
  • Lithium ion batteries with a Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 100 per battery not exceeding 2 batteries per package

Hazard Label: Not required

Prerequisite: Batteries must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • The Watt-hour rating must be marked on the outside of the battery case except those manufactured before 1 January 2009

The inner packagings must be packed in strong outer packagings.

Packaging: Not approved. Each package must be capable of withstanding a 1.2 m drop test in any orientation without damage to cells contained therein, without shifting of the contents so as to allow cell to cell contact and without release of contents.

Quantity limit: 2 batteries if Watt-hour rating 2.7 < Wh ≤ 100 per battery

Weight limit: 2.5 kg Net if Watt-hour rating ≤ 2.7 Wh/battery

  • The package contains lithium ion batteries;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.
